page.title: 19MY MILK ROUND
page.content: I help a milkman on Saturday mornings and Thursday nights. This is harder now that we deliver Sunday's milk on saturday. The milkman is a cheery sort of character as he is always full of bounce and joy. Even when things go wrong, such as leaving people out, he just takes it with a pinch of salt. When he calls at houses for money he always asks them if they would like anything else, trying to increase his goods balance. When I ask them they try to be polite but nearly always say no. One of the main "let-downs" on our round is the float. It is a 'J' reg. and only has a top speed of ten miles per hour. One day last week Reg had to swop floats because he just ran out of electicity. We were about half way round when it just wouldn't go, so we telephoned the dairy and they brought out another one.
